args:
Though Karina agrees to perform, she struggles
to fill the role of a princess, but manages to
defeat her mental block thanks to the prince's
encouragement. On the day of the opera, the
prince heads out to deliver the ransom money
while Karina prepares for her big debut.
We're lucky you're the same size as Bella.\nI am certain you will fill in splendidly!
Well, I'll give it my best, but...
What did I do wrong this time?
What is this shallow performance?!\nThe utter pedantry of it makes the\ngorge rise in my throat!
Where is the FEELING?!\nWhere is the EMOTION?!
You do understand that this opera is a\ntragic love story about a prince and\nprincess from rival lands, yes?
Fate has brought them together, but they\nare ENEMIES! And to make matters worse,\nshe is already arranged to be married!

But when the prince and her fiancé duel,
she is laid low while trying to stop them!
It is GRIEVOUS! It is TRAGIC! Oh, but tears
well up in my eyes just speaking of it!
It's an emotional story...but your singing\nmight as well be the dull recitation of\na primer on mathematical theory!
Giovanni, she's not a professional.\nGo easy on her.

Does that matter?! WRONG! IT DOES NOT!
When you are on MY stage, Karina, I will
not suffer you to bark and flop about like
a common harbor seal!
I'm out. I quit. That clear enough for you?
You've got plenty of other ladies here who\ncan take a crack at this role; I'm clearly\njust wasting everyone's precious time.
It's the same melody and words no matter\nwho's singing it, so let's just let someone\nwith more talent do it instead.
Alas, but it is a bitter blow! I so wanted\nto hear an aria only you could sing!
Yar, sorry to let you down.
...I never would have agreed to this stupid\nplan if I knew what the role was!
You okay, Karina? Sounds like rehearsal\ngot sort of...um...scream-y.
I was actually excited about this at first,\nyou know? I mean, I love new challenges.\nBut it's clearly just a terrible idea.
They want me to play the part of a princess\nthrown into an arranged marriage, and it...\nWell, I guess it hits too close to home.
I used to be a princess before I became\na pirate. Pretty sure I mentioned it?
Just thinking of it sets me creep-o-meter\nto eleven. If I hadn't run away...
And that's preventing you from getting\nin touch with the character?
Yeah. I mean, if the princess in the opera\njust ran away with her prince sooner,\nshe'd still be alive!
I know it's only a story, but I just can't\nget over how terrible this opera lady's\ndecision-making process is.
Not to be rude, but how hard have you\nreally tried to see it from her perspective?
That's...! Yeah, okay. That's a fair point.\nBut even so, I know myself well enough to\nunderstand how it'll probably work out.
Well then, why don't we break down\nwhat it is about it that's bothering you?
I don't know. This seems like a lot of\ntrouble to go to just for my sake.
You're the one playing the part now, right?\nThere's no reason you have to think about\nit exactly like Bella would have.
Hmm, okay. So I guess my main issue is\nthat the princess doesn't just take off with\nthe prince to go live her own life.
Right, but your fiancé won't allow that—he\ncomes after you and demands to fight your\nprince. So what does Princess Karina do?
Nobody fights a battle for me BUT me!\nTake five, lover—Karina's got this!
Er, okay. But I feel like your love probably\nwouldn't be good just...taking five while\nyou go off and duel somebody.
Okay, I get it. So I LET my prince have his\nduel, but once he starts getting his butt\nkicked, I jump in to save him...and...
I get it now... This princess didn't die\nat the whims of those around her.
She died protecting someone she loves—\nit's her choice.
So do you think maybe there IS a way for\nyou to empathize with this character?
I mean, it's sort of like how you made the\nchoice to leave your castle in order to live\nyour own life, right?
Yeah... For the sake of the one she loved,\nat the very end, she took control of her\nown life.
Yeah, okay. That's a role I can play.\nHell, it might be a role ONLY I can play!
I'm impressed, bud! That's some grade-A\ndramatic interpretation right there.
Not really. I just felt that the princess's\nfeelings were understandable.
I mean, we all can relate to wanting to\nrun away from bad circumstances.
Well, I'm off. Good luck, Karina!
({player_name} of all people\nsaying he relates to that...heh...)
...Giovanni? Look. I know we've had our\ndifferences here, but I want to give this\nsinging thing another shot.
My word... When I look into your eyes,\nI see pure, unadulterated PASSION!
This is magical! A breakthrough!\nNow sing for me! SING!
Come, come! We must gather the\nensemble and begin rehearsal at once!
This opera must be a success!
It's a full house, which means we have\nenough money to cover the ransom.
Bravo, everyone! But we still have to put\non the show and ensure our audience\ngets what they came for!
Indeed we must! But as for the money...\nHere, {player_name}. Take it.
Er, why are you looking at me like that\nKarina? Is there something on my face?
...It's nothing. Go on, keep it safe.
Hopefully we'll be able to break Bella out\nwithout having to hand this over.
I can't forgive Lapis for what she's done,\nand I want to see her brought to justice.
Oh, she's a menace and no mistake—but\ngetting Bella back should be your priority.
Please, dear prince! Return our beloved\nsongstress to us safe and sound!
We will. In the meantime,\nbreak a leg, everyone!
Uh, were there always this many fiends\non this road, or is it just our lucky day?
We cleared this entire area out\nnot a fortnight ago.
Still, we can't get bogged down now.\nLet's deal with the fiends and save Bella!
